alert.note: Alert for Eureka (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 31 at 10:13AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Marys River Near Deeth affecting Elko County. Humboldt River Near Elko affecting Elko County. Lamoille Creek Above Lamoille affecting Elko County. Humboldt River At Palisade affecting Eureka County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Marys River...including Deeth, Test - Charleston, Charleston...elevated river levels are forecast. For the Upper Humboldt...including Elko, Test - Elko, Carlin... elevated river levels are forecast. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Palisade. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins between Carlin and Battle Mountains. This is about 3650 cfs. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:55 AM PDT Wednesday the stage was 6.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.8 feet late this morning. - Action stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1015 AM PDT.
